instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
water damage areas u6201,u8900/50 cleaned
got orangelight u7100 basic voltage is present and normal
there is no short on bigcoils
PP3V42_G3H 3.4v
PPBUS_G3H 4.7v
SMC_RESET_L 3.3v
PP3V3_S5_REG 3.3v
SMC_PM_G2_EN 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H 3.1v
PP3V3_SUS 0v 0.444
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0v 0.432

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H 4.7v
-----------------
PP3V3_S5_REG 3.3v"
Please, check PPBUS_G3H voltage again (F7140).

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
really 4.7v @f7140 both sides
PP3V3_S5_REG 3.3v @l7560

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: Remove F7140/41 and check C7140 voltage.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
Keep the fuses out now.
The problem is on U7100 area.
Post its basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also check ohm resistance between 17/18 and 27/28.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
after i replace u7100 now ppbus is 12.59v F7140/41resoldered back.
u7100 17-18 3.30hms 27-28 26.56ohms
1 - 0V
2- 19.3V
3 - 4.7v
9 - 0v
12 - 3.4v
13 - 3.3v
14 - 3.3v
15 - 0v
17 - 12.5v
19 - 5.5v
20 - 5.5v
25 - 17v
27 - 20v

this still no voltage
PP3V3_SUS 0v 0.444
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0v 0.432

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
No need to check U7100, if already got correct PPBUS_G3H.

Do you now get 3V3_S5?

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: 3V3_S5 only 2.3v

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: Post basic voltages for U7501; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
"now ppbus is 12.59v F7140/41resoldered back
------------------------
23 1.8V"
Broken trace?

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
i replaced u7100 again.

now:
23 is now 12.9v

3V3_S5 3.3v

this still no voltage machine still unable to on.
PP3V3_SUS 0v 0.444
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0v 0.432

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
3V3_SUS requires PM_SLP_SUS_L to be high.
To release it, PCH also requires some signals; did you check them?

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: all pch rtc signal  is present.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: If the 4 RTC signals present, then check PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_BATLOW_L.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message: PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_BATLOW_L also all present

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
Also check SMC_ADAPTER_EN.
If PM_SLP_SUS_L still missing, there is a PCH problem.

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN is ok
PM_SLP_SUS_L missing

threads.title: 820-3787 no power
threads.message:
Try heating PCH with quality flux.
May have luck to be an issue caused by accumularted crap underneath.
